definition: (of a child etc) small as a mite/minuscule

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: He lives in that match-box of a house.
sentences.chinese: 他住的房子火柴盒那么点大。

sentences.english: Alas, you so does the height with big drop also want 10 yuan one week?
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，你这么点大的个儿也要10元一星期？

definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
how old?/how big?/how much?/so big/that much
classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several
to appear to be/to seem as if
qualities that make sth worth seeing (or reading)
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
dialectal equivalent of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
